subject: Design
title: The London Underground Map: Diagram Beats Geography
description: A micro-lesson that makes The London Underground Map: Diagram Beats Geography usable.

hook.text: Harry Beck's 1931 Tube map ignored real geography entirely. It worked better than any accurate map.

buildup.text: Beck, an engineering draftsman, realized riders don't care about distance â€” they care about connections.

discovery.text: He replaced curves with straight lines and equal spacing. The result was a circuit diagram, not a map.

twist.text: London Transport initially rejected Beck's design as 'too radical.' A trial print sold out instantly.

climax.text: Every metro map in the world â€” Tokyo, New York, Paris â€” copies Beck's approach.

punchline.text: The best map in history is technically wrong about everything.

quiz.question: What did Harry Beck's Tube map prioritize over geographic accuracy?
